pages.text: Oceans are one of the most common biome types. They come in ten different variants: frozen, cold, normal, lukewarm and warm, each with a deep variant. Warm deep oceans do not generate, though.

Mob spawning works as usual on islands that are still considered ocean biome. In any ocean, $(l:mobs/squid)squids$(), $(l:mobs/zombie)drowneds$() and variant-dependent $(l:mobs/fish)fish variants$() can spawn, along with $(l:blocks/kelp)kelp plants$() (not in frozen oceans), $(l:blocks/seagrass)seagrass$(), $(l:structures/shipwreck)shipwrecks$() and $(l:structures/ocean_ruin)ocean ruins$(). Additionally, $(l:structures/ocean_monument)ocean monuments$() can spawn in all five deep ocean variants.

Frozen oceans have a frozen surface with occasional icebergs. There is less seagrass than in all other ocean variants. $(l:mobs/polar_bear)Polar bears$() can spawn on the surface, cods and salmons can spawn underwater.
pages.title: Frozen

pages.text: Cold oceans are quite unspectacular. Cods and salmons spawn underwater frequently.$(br2)Normal oceans are almost the same, but rarely, pufferfish and $(l:mobs/dolphin)dolphins$() can spawn as well.$(br2)In a lukewarm ocean, these spawn more frequently.
pages.title: Cold/Normal/Lukewarm

pages.text: Warm oceans, on the other side, have some fairly unique stuff. Cods and salmons do not spawn here, instead, all variants of tropical fish spawn. Dolphins and pufferfish spawn as well.$(br2)The most important part of this biome, however, are $(l:blocks/coral)coral reefs$() and $(l:blocks/sea_pickle)sea pickles$(). These do only spawn here.
pages.title: Warm
